title: Asian stocks open higher after US gains, oil rises
summary: Asian equities opened higher, mirroring US stock gains driven by benign jobs data. Oil prices climbed as protests intensified in Iran, raising geopolitical concerns. Despite lingering uncertainties, global markets exhibit a fragile calm, with tech shares potentially boosted by strong Taiwanese semiconductor revenue.

title: After asset quality hit, small finance banks to sharpen risk controls for 2026
summary: Small finance banks are strengthening their risk management. They plan to reduce unsecured loans and boost secured lending like vehicle and housing loans. Credit guarantee schemes will cover more microfinance loans. This strategy aims to prevent asset quality issues. Banks like ESAF, Suryoday, Ujjivan, and Utkarsh are implementing these changes to ensure stability and growth.

title: Nifty in a bear hug, needs to break above 26,100 levels: Analysts
summary: Indian equity markets face a bearish outlook as the Nifty breaks key supports. Analysts predict further declines, with the Nifty potentially testing the 25,300 to 25,350 levels. Sentiment is unlikely to improve without a strong rebound above 26,100. Investors are advised to adopt a sell-on-rise strategy.

title: Stocks in news: TCS, HCL Tech, DMart, ICICI Lombard, RIL, Lemon Tree Hotels
summary: Markets extended their decline on Friday, mirroring weak global cues and disrupting the Nifty's short-term up move. Several companies like TCS, HCL Tech, and RIL are in focus due to Q3 results and significant investment announcements, including Adani Group's Rs 1.5 lakh crore commitment in Kutch.

title: Pre-market action: Here's the trade setup for today's session
summary: Indian equity benchmarks extended their losing streak for the fifth consecutive session, closing lower amid weak global cues and geopolitical tensions. Today, Q3 earnings from TCS and HCL Tech will be in focus, alongside potential US trade policy commentary. The market sentiment appears decisively negative, with the India VIX rising.

title: Banks to review Vodafone Idea funding plan after AGR relief
summary: Bankers said the decision has altered the company's liability profile, adding that clarity on its funding needs and future business plans are crucial for considering fresh funding.

title: Looking sharp! Trent plans high store density in mature markets
summary: Trent’s strategy is similar to some of the world’s largest retailers, including Spain’s Inditex, owner of Zara, and British department store chain Primark, which has long prioritised dense store networks in high-footfall catchments, using scale for more bargaining power with vendors and real estate developers.

title: Stock Radar: Bajaj Auto breaks out from triangle pattern to hit fresh highs in January 2026; what should investors do?
summary: Bajaj Auto shares have surged to new record highs after breaking a technical pattern. Experts suggest this upward trend may continue. Traders are advised to consider buying the stock for potential gains in the coming weeks. The company's stock is performing well, trading above key moving averages. Strong delivery volumes and sector recovery support this positive outlook.

title: Credit demand zooms as policy eases, outstanding bank credit crossed Rs 200 lakh cr for the first time on Dec 31, 2025
summary: India's credit demand is surging. Lower taxes and supportive monetary policy are fueling investment. Outstanding bank credit has crossed a major milestone. This growth surpasses projections, indicating a strong economic rebound. Auto loans, small and mid-sized companies, and home loans are key drivers. Investment intentions are translating into spending, creating a positive environment.

title: Breakout stocks to buy or sell: Amid US-Iran conflict, Sumeet Bagadia recommends five shares to buy today
summary: Breakout stocks to buy or sell: Sumeet Bagadia recommends five shares to buy today — CCL Products (India), KSB, HCL Technologies, Endurance Technologies, and Ramco Cements.

title: Stock market today: Trade guide for Nifty 50 to gold, silver rates — eight stocks to buy or sell on 12 January 2026
summary: Stock market today: Experts have recommended eight stocks to buy today — Ashok Leyland, Ipca Laboratories, Reliance Industries, SAIL, Gujarat Pipavav Port, Ramco Cements, Aarti Pharmalabs, and Asian Paints.&nbsp;

title: Government spending crucial, hope it does not pursue aggressive tightening, says Canara Robeco AMC’s equity CIO
summary: Expectations from the budget are limited as it often excites markets but rarely delivers major changes, with taxation and strategic decisions increasingly happening outside it, says Shridatta Bhandwaldar, CIO-equities at anara Robeco AMC

title: Stocks to buy: Raja Venkatraman's recommends two energy stocks for 12 January
summary: Market expert Raja Venkatraman shares his top energy stocks to buy today, 12 January. Discover his exclusive picks and analysis to inform your investment strategy.

summary: MarketSmith India reveals its top stock recommendations for today, 12 January. Get expert insights into the best-performing stocks to guide your investment decisions.

title: NSE's unlisted shares back in focus as Sebi chief says IPO nod likely by month-end
summary: The mandatory no-objection certificate for NSE has been&nbsp;pending&nbsp;since Sebi permitted the exchange to expedite the process of share transfer between investors in March last year.

title: Australian shares rise, banks and consumer discretionary stocks lead gains
summary: AUSTRALIA-STOCKS/ MIDDAY:Australian shares rise, banks and consumer discretionary stocks lead gains

title: Holiday-shortened Q3 won’t hold surprises for IT, but investors will search for demand signals
summary: Revenue growth for most technology firms in the seasonally weak Q3 is muted due to furloughs, lower utilization and continued macro-economic uncertainty.

title: Yuan Optimism Grows as Dollar Hedging Costs Hit Three-Year Low
summary: Growing optimism toward the Chinese yuan is spreading into hedging activities, with the cost that mainland investors have to pay to guard against possible dollar losses falling to a three-year low.

title: Peak bearish bets signal turbulent week for market
summary: Foreign investors and prop traders pump up their futures and options shorts amid rising uncertaity of US -India trade deal , falling rupee&nbsp;

title: Security Startup Torq Raises Cash at $1.2 Billion Valuation
summary: The Israeli cybersecurity startup Torq is planning to announce Sunday that it has closed a $140 million funding round, raising its valuation to $1.2 billion.

title: Swiggy expands Noice beyond staples, testing limits of private labels in quick commerce
summary: Swiggy is rapidly scaling its in-house brand Noice from 200 to 350 SKUs, and hiring top-tier talent from Flipkart and Oyo to transform the label into a standalone consumer brand.

title: Mint explainer: What does DMart’s leadership change mean?
summary: The streamlined structure marks a departure from DMart’s recent years of increasingly layered management and reflects a sharper focus on execution across its core categories.

title: Europe’s Gender Pay Gap for Finance Boards at Worst in Six Years
summary: The gender pay gap on the boards of European financial services firms widened to its worst level in six years.

title: Beyond the corner office: Why Indian employers are betting on executive coaches to retain talent
summary: Indian companies are expanding executive coaching beyond CXOs to high-potential managers to improve retention amid volatility, AI disruption, and changing leadership expectations. Employers see coaching as an ROI-positive investment that will help in moderating salary costs.

title: Infosys risks losing $150 million a year from one of its largest clients
summary: Infosys provided iPhone cases, laptops, Microsoft 365 subscriptions, and fingerprint readers for Daimler's IT operations, but there were differences between the two over execution and billing delays.&nbsp;

title: China’s PE Trailblazer Hopu Faces Doubts on Returns, Succession
summary: For years, Fang Fenglei was Wall Street’s go-to fixer in China — a partner to heavyweights like Goldman Sachs Group Inc. who built one of Asia’s most prominent private equity firms.

title: What is the tax implication if my NRI husband transfers foreign funds to me?
summary: If any money is received without consideration and if the aggregate value exceeds  ₹50,000, it is taxable in the hands of the recipient unless it is received from a ‘relative'.
